name: OpenSSH 9.3p1 < 9.3p2 Multiple Vulnerabilities
synopsis: The remote SSH server is affected by multiple vulnerabilities.
description: The version of OpenSSH running on the remote host is 9.3p1, which is prior to 9.3p2. It is, therefore, affected by a vulnerability in the forwarded ssh-agent that may allow attackers to bypass authentication. An attacker with access to the Unix socket can perform unauthorized actions.
solution: Upgrade to OpenSSH version 9.3p2 or later.
plugin_output: Remote SSH version: OpenSSH_9.3p1 | Path: /usr/bin/sshd | Installed version: 9.3p1 | Fixed version: 9.3p2

name: Linux Kernel 5.15.x < 5.15.112 Privilege Escalation
synopsis: The remote Linux kernel is affected by a privilege escalation vulnerability.
description: The version of the Linux kernel running on the remote host is 5.15.x prior to 5.15.112. It is, therefore, affected by a use-after-free vulnerability in Netfilter nf_tables that allows local attackers to escalate privileges to root.
solution: Upgrade the Linux kernel to version 5.15.112 or later. Alternatively update to a patched distribution kernel.
plugin_output: Kernel version: 5.15.102-generic | Path: /boot/vmlinuz-5.15.102-generic | Detected via: uname -r | Affected subsystem: nf_tables (Netfilter) | Host OS: Ubuntu 22.04 LTS

name: Microsoft Windows SMB Information Disclosure
synopsis: The remote Windows host is affected by an information disclosure vulnerability.
description: The remote Windows host is missing a security update. It is, therefore, affected by an information disclosure vulnerability in the Server Message Block (SMB) protocol. An unauthenticated attacker could exploit this to obtain sensitive information from the target system's memory.
solution: Apply the latest Windows security updates from Microsoft Update.
plugin_output: Service: Microsoft Windows SMB | Windows Version: Windows Server 2019 Build 17763 | Path: C:\Windows\System32\srv2.sys | SMB Version: SMB 3.1.1 | Missing KB: KB5023702

name: Docker Daemon API Exposed Without Authentication
synopsis: The Docker daemon API is exposed without proper authentication.
description: The Docker daemon on the remote host is exposing its API on TCP port 2375 without TLS or authentication enabled. This allows any network-accessible attacker to execute arbitrary commands inside containers, deploy malicious containers, or extract sensitive data from existing containers.
solution: Reconfigure Docker daemon to use TLS authentication. Set DOCKER_TLS_VERIFY=1 and configure certificates. Never expose daemon socket on 2375 without authentication.
plugin_output: Docker API endpoint: http://10.0.2.10:2375 | Path: /var/run/docker.sock exposed via tcp://0.0.0.0:2375 | Docker version: 24.0.5 | Configuration file: /etc/docker/daemon.json | Security settings: TLS disabled authentication disabled | Container count: 15 running containers accessible

name: Kubernetes API Server Bypass Authentication
synopsis: The Kubernetes API server is affected by an authentication bypass vulnerability.
description: The version of Kubernetes running on the remote host is affected by a vulnerability in the API server that could allow an attacker to bypass authentication under certain conditions when using delegated authentication with the ValidatingAdmissionPolicy feature enabled.
solution: Upgrade Kubernetes to version 1.27.3 or 1.26.6 or 1.25.11 or later depending on your release track.
plugin_output: Kubernetes version: v1.27.1 | API Server path: /usr/local/bin/kube-apiserver | Configuration: /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube-apiserver.yaml | ValidatingAdmissionPolicy: Enabled | Authentication mode: delegated | Cluster: production-cluster-01

name: containerd CRI Stream Server Information Disclosure
synopsis: The container runtime is affected by an information disclosure vulnerability.
description: The version of containerd running on the remote host (1.6.18) is affected by an information disclosure vulnerability. Supplementary groups are not set up properly in the CRI stream server, which could allow containers to access files they should not have access to.
solution: Upgrade containerd to version 1.6.19 or later.
plugin_output: Containerd version: 1.6.18 | Path: /usr/bin/containerd | Configuration: /etc/containerd/config.toml | CRI plugin: Enabled | Running containers: 8 | Image: docker.io/library/nginx:1.24 | Container ID: a3f2bc8e9d47

name: Apache HTTP Server 2.4.x < 2.4.56 HTTP Response Splitting
synopsis: The remote web server is affected by an HTTP response splitting vulnerability.
description: The version of Apache HTTP Server installed on the remote host is 2.4.x prior to 2.4.56. It is, therefore, affected by an HTTP response splitting vulnerability in mod_proxy_uwsgi. An attacker could exploit this to perform cache poisoning or cross-site scripting attacks.
solution: Upgrade to Apache HTTP Server version 2.4.56 or later.
plugin_output: Apache version: 2.4.54 | Path: /usr/sbin/apache2 | Server configuration: /etc/apache2/apache2.conf | Detected module: mod_proxy_uwsgi (enabled) | Virtual hosts: 3 configured | Application: production-api-gateway | DocumentRoot: /var/www/api

name: Node.js mainModule Bypass Vulnerability
synopsis: The Node.js application is using a vulnerable version affected by policy bypass.
description: The Node.js runtime (version 18.15.0) running the application has a vulnerability in the policy mechanism. The experimental policy mechanism can be bypassed using module.constructor.createRequire, allowing attackers to load modules that should be restricted by the policy.
solution: Upgrade Node.js to version 18.16.1 or 20.3.1 or later. Update all Node.js applications.
plugin_output: Node.js version: v18.15.0 | Path: /usr/local/bin/node | Application: customer-portal | Package.json: /opt/app/customer-portal/package.json | Main module: /opt/app/customer-portal/server.js | Policy file: /opt/app/customer-portal/policy.json | npm dependencies: 247 packages | Vulnerable dependency chain: express@4.18.2 -> node runtime
